website_summaries.verdict: One of the more comfortable touch mice that you'll find anywhere with a rubber grip surface.
pros: Seems to give users a high level of precise control versus most other touch mice options
Provides you with a long battery life of up to 18 months
Looks a bit more like a traditional mouse than some touch mice options
Available in five different color and design options
cons: Sensitivity on this touch mouse could be better
Many features made for Windows 8 specifically

customer_reviews.title: If I lost mine, I'd happily and promptly buy the same again. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.text: It may be weird to gush over a piece of electronics, but I really like this mouse! It fits well in my hand, is lightweight, and I like how I can scroll up and down or side-to-side. If I did a ton of left-right scrolling, I'd want a larger surface for that, but I'd guess at least 95% of my scrolling is up-down. I have taken this mouse to travel with me many times. If I lost this mouse, I'd happily and promptly buy it again. But I really like it, so I keep track of it, because I don't want to lose it. Know what I mean?
customer_reviews.author: mora24

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and functional
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I have owned and use at work - liked the first one so much I ordered another. (I dropped it too often walking to and from meetings, so the right mouse button eventually stopped working). I love that the "mouse wheel" is just a touch surface that doesn't make the annoying clicking noise. Another feature of the "mouse wheel": you can quickly scroll to the top or bottom of a document or webpage with a vigorous "swipe" up or down.
customer_reviews.author: SardiusW

customer_reviews.title: A good deal and a good value. A very rugged wireless mouse !
customer_reviews.text: This mouse works very well, especially for someone with mild arthritis.. the touch panel is a welcome change from the normal scroll wheel. In addition the mouse is much more rugged.. I've broken several scroll wheel cordless mice in my bag,, and since there are effectively no moving parts, it's much stronger. The only negative is the effect that the side rubberized panels have after some time has passed.. they look sort of dingy, as a side effect of the type of rubber used. There's no cure for that. Because this mouse was used, I used alcohol swabs to clean it off before using it.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Belt

customer_reviews.title: Good Response, portable, can use Right or Left Handed.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with a "touch mouse". I actually bought this refurbished as an experiment so see whether I would like the technology or not. 2 months later I've decided I really like it. I downloaded the latest software from Logitech and the mouse is quite responsive. The swipe feature works just as described, just make sure your hands aren't clammy when using it. Its a decent smaller size good for folks looking for portability. The neutral shape means it's good for both right handed and left handed use (Yes, I mouse with either hand). I paired this with my Logitech K360 with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ya Gooch

customer_reviews.title: Great battery life...
customer_reviews.text: Well you know you are searching to say you like something if you simple praise the battery life. I wanted to like this mouse but the middle button just does not work that well for me. Call me stupid or something but the middle button is not consistent. I have all of the software installed but maybe I need to tweak it or something. I would only suggest when this is on sale again. I would buy this over a scroll wheel and will probably even buy another one for a different machine. The battery life really is amazing. Just that alone will save you enough money in batteries to make this pay you to take it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Mouse for Windows 8
customer_reviews.text: After struggling with an optical, wireless mouse and then a wired mouse for Windows 8.1, I was at a loss as to what to do. I couldn't get the mice to work properly due to dragging, "freezing", and being unable to direct the pointer correctly. So, I thought I would order this one, as it stated it would work with Windows 8. Yes, it does! It worked perfectly the first time I connected it, and it glides smoothly over the window contents and doesn't hesitate for a minute! Also, the feature of being able to access the "desktop" and "Windows" screen, with just a click, is fantastic! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Logitech zone T400 - windows 8 --Very good little mouse for money !
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this, after buying a Windows 8 Laptop was pretty stretched out on money..so I purchased this mouse since the windows 8 computer OS system is touch. This little mouse really surprised me...very Good response and works well with touch gestures. For the Price, you would think cheep, but not at all. Made me give up my Kensington trackball mouse I paid good money for and switch over to this and Im fussy when it comes to comfort. Install the drivers .I did'nt at first i was pressed for time, later went back to install drivers and it works even better on responses and touch and scrolls with ease of gestures.
customer_reviews.author: MissT

customer_reviews.title: I love this mouse
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. I initially bought it because the roller on my other mouse was so loud. Doing my school work in the evenings, waking up my kids with my mouse! I purchased this in hopes of letting them sleep peacefully. MISSION ACCOMPLISHED! I love this mouse, it is sleek, yet has just enough to it to feel very well put together. I love that where the bottom opens to put the battery, there is a place to put the USB so it doesn't get lost during travel. Well done LOGITECH!
customer_reviews.author: ThisIsTheDay

customer_reviews.title: Very attractive mouse
customer_reviews.text: I ordered several wireless mouse's to use with my new Windows 8.1 OS laptop. The old couchmouse...which I loved and used for years with Windows 7 OS laptop just seemed to glitchy with the 8.1. This was my least favorite, seemed to still have the glitches, jumps, skips, disappears as the couchmouse. I'm also not a fan of the flat space in place of the wheel and that may just be that I didn't give myself a chance to get used to it...my finger was always in the wrong place and I was uncoordinated scrolling with it. It is a very attractive mouse and I think the problems may be with Windows 8...8.1 and not the wireless mouse.
customer_reviews.author: G. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse to use with Windows 8's touch features, but the touch area on the mouse is not very sensitive. Often, sliding your fingers across the surface does nothing. When it does work it either scrolls too slowly or too fast. I've adjust the settings, but it just never works consistently. Tracking is just average and it also has only two buttons. I've had it since spring of 2013 and stopped using it in the summer, opting for the Anywhere Mouse MX instead (which is great, btw). I REALLY wish I would have sent it back.
customer_reviews.author: Leader Desslok

customer_reviews.title: Top is Too Smooth
customer_reviews.text: Posted the below too early. I've now used it for two days and it drove me crazy as the top is just like the touchpad on my laptop. I'm now using a Logitech M525 and it works great. It works but the top is difficult since it is very smooth on top and with no wheel you basically have a remote touch pad. If the center pad was raised or had a different feel than the outside area it would be 100% better. I would prefer a wheel in the center with real buttons on either side. Otherwise it is well built unit at a good price. Lots of luck finding another mouse that will work with Windows 8.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh R. F. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Tell your touch-pad to hit the road
customer_reviews.text: This Logitech T400 Zone Touch WiFi mouse works beautifully with windows 8 and RT or windows 7. So much better than that built in laptop headache they call a touch-pad. Comes with a mini receiver for USB port. Don't have to load a CD just download software from site and wham-bam thank you ma'am works great. Has long battery life 18 months and replaces with a couple AA batteries. It's rubber grip feels good in the hand and has a 3 year limited hardware warranty. So click that order button with that touch-pad one last time and feel the freedom!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Washburn

customer_reviews.title: Great travel mouse - the touch scroll strip is not quite ready for prime time
customer_reviews.text: A great mouse for travel. Very precise and works on most surfaces. Small form factor which doesn't take up much room and the dongle is small enough to leave in the USB port permanently. The main draw back is that the touch scroll pad in the middle is very sensitive and when using excel if you accidentally touch the strip the mouse scrolls down multiple pages. I switched off the sideways scrolling as while this was great for web browsing it made the excel use much worse. I will keep working on the settings to see if I can get to a point where I can make better use of the touch strip.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Chick

customer_reviews.title: Good Mouse
customer_reviews.text: It was a bit on the expensive side for me, but it is a nice mouse. I like being able to swipe side to side in the Windows 8 interface, and using Logitech's software you can map the buttons how you like and change the behavior of the mouse. I swapped the middle click and the back-of-the-middle click so that if I click the front of the middle button, it registers as a middle click, and if I click the back of it, it registers as a "home screen" button. Others may prefer the default, which is the opposite. The mouse is comfortable, and it looks very nice/professional. Definitely a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: ledi51

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth - great price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse for my son's laptop, but it was so smooth compared to my wireless microsoft mouse, I was tempted to keep it for myself. I should have known better... the last wireless Logitech mouse I had was also very smooth and lasted for years through multiple computer upgrades. This mouse feels as comfortable in my 40+ year-old-hand as it apparently does in my 8-year-old son's hand. The buttons are very responsive, and the touch zone control feels very natural. It's not Logitech's latest model, so prices for it online is very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Price - NOT

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse, can't imagine working without it!
customer_reviews.text: Love to have scrolling functions like the apple mouse on PC! I was surprised to see more features the mouse can do once plugged into my computer. A definite must have for PC. I do a lot of work with graphics, so to have an option to zoom in and out with a single tap on the middle button was very convenient!
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Windows 10 Ready
customer_reviews.text: Ordered Saturday, arrived Monday. I got this for my Surface Pro 3 and the Windows 10 experience as well as for my desktop. Other than having a few minor scuffs that was buffed out with a microfiber towel (it did state good condition), this is a fantastic mouse and it plays very well with the UI in W10. Liking its lightweight and the glass works well. I'm surprised at the comfort, for having large hands this works for me. Hopefully this lasts long as my other Logitech devices.
customer_reviews.author: IMIAN

customer_reviews.title: Worth buying
customer_reviews.text: The size and shape of the mouse is about perfect. It is slightly larger than most portable laptop mice and slightly smaller than most desktop mice. The mouse is very comfortable to use and I have large hands. The scrolling works good, although occasionally I find myself trying to scroll only to realize my finger is just outside of the scroll area. Maybe it just takes a bit more use with it to perfect it. I haven't tested the mouse with Windows 7, but works perfectly with Windows 8. I can recommend this mouse, especially with the fair price. Logitech mice are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett S.

customer_reviews.title: Great shape, very comfortable to use, small USB interface, On/Off switch, and LOVE the color.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse has a nice shape that makes it easy to use my laptop all day long. I especially like that the USB interface is very small, as I move my laptop around, and don't have to worry about it being knocked off. Still learning how to use the scoll feature - it really moves quite fast when scrolling, so I need more practice. Really love that this mouse has an On/Off switch on the bottom to save the battery. I've been using this mouse for over a month now and I've very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Rivera

customer_reviews.title: The best Mouse I have ever used!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was the best Mouse I have ever used! In addition to it being very nice looking, it worked soooooo well! I loved how comfortable it was to use! And it worked in either hand. The center could scroll both up and down, as well as side to side!! Perfect for those without the touch screen using Windows 8.1!!! You will be happy with this mouse! No complaints! (Except that other people will definitely want to steal it, which is what happened to me!)
customer_reviews.author: Day

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware. Great Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse for my CEO since she broke her last traditional scroll type mouse. The Red Velvet color in the picture is definitely as accurate as it looks in person, it's hard to misplace being this bright. As far as the functionality of the mouse it operates like any other, but there is an option to setup gestures in both Windows 7 and 8. I just ordered one for myself to use with my windows 8 laptop. You can never go wrong with a logitech product.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle W. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking hybrid mouse, works on other windows platforms too
customer_reviews.text: I bought this originally because I thought a 'touch' mouse would reduce the clicking noise of using the right and left buttons. The only thing that is 'touch' is the scroll function. It works well with a regular PC and also with other Windows platforms. I used it with no issues on Windows 7. If you use a scroll wheel excessively all day this would be a relief for your scroll finger. Otherwise it's just a nice looking mouse. Clicking sound is average for others in its class.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: I have worn several scroll wheels out, so the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have worn several scroll wheels out, so the touch scroll was what attracted me to this mouse. It does what it's supposed to do. The batteries are a little easier to put in/take out than Microsoft mice I've had in the past. I'd probably buy it again
customer_reviews.author: Earthican

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic mouse for the price
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is plug and play, with an option to install software for further customization of the center button. Sensitivity is just like any other perfectly fine mouse, and the touch scroll area works just as well, if not better than a normal mouse wheel. On an additional note, I used this mouse for the first time today and didn't feel any ergonomic discomfort from this mouse. Fits the hand great. I would buy this mouse again.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Jhonson

customer_reviews.title: Forgets pressed button
customer_reviews.text: BAD: When holding the left button down and performing an action (moving scroll bar, dragging file across the desktop), the mouse forgets the held down button and resets. This doesn't happen with my old Logitech mouse. Will return this and purchase the older model. GOOD: The non-button scrolling is smooth. I especially liked the left and right gestures for browsers. The rubber grip is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Rajo

customer_reviews.title: The best mouse I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this mouse. It fits perfectly in my right hand. The battery consumption is ridiculously low - the battery stays almost forever. This is the second one I have.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Solid mouse even though it's not bluetooth.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouse I now have two, one for work and one for home. The only issue is that once in a while the pages jump which is kind of annoying but overall it's a great mouse. I don't really like having to have the dongle but it's very slim so it's not a problem especially given that the bluetooth "mice" are at least twice as much and my cheapness is satisfied with these.
customer_reviews.author: M. R. Mosher

customer_reviews.title: neato
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat little device. It recognizes the gestures, and there is a learning curve, but it is a lot like the touch pad on the laptop. I've accidently used a few gestures, but nothing to irritate me. Also, the sensitivity can be turned down so if it is a bother it is fixable. I'm just sure I will grow more familiar with it so I haven't changed anything. I've played a few games with it on ultra settings and haven't noticed any lagging or dragging. This is what I had purchased it for anyway, so I am very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: I love this little mouse!!!
customer_reviews.text: I use my laptop about two times a week. I've had this mouse for over two years and have yet to change the batteries! And there are times that I forgot to turn it off for a couple days. I do wish it had programmable buttons and didn't use a dongle. Still by far my favorite bluetooth mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Lux

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of the reviews on this mouse and others and decided to try this one. I'm glad I did. I have small hands and it fits my hand very well. It works great with windows 8. The middle button works great at going side to side and its very responsive. It takes a little getting use to but after about 30 minutes it was like second nature. Also the setup on it was very easy. I'm not a technical person and it was very easy for even me.
customer_reviews.author: jaylor

customer_reviews.title: Logitech wireless T400 mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Another nice quality product from Logitech. It has tradition and new designs combine in one. It is win8 ready mouse but it runs fine on win vista. It has an on-off button on bottom, has a built-in glass piece which you use it to scroll up & down or left & right easily. It has rubber on the sides so you can have a firm grip. I played online FPS games with this mouse, worked perfectly, no lag at all. For people who prefer a simple high quality mouse, I highly recommended this.
customer_reviews.author: Henry's dad

customer_reviews.title: Nice mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse works really well on many surfaces, including my pants. It was actually smaller than I expected it to be, but I've come to like the size. I'm also now of the opinion that the touch scroll button is superior than a wheel in both responsiveness and speed. It also scrolls side-to-side. I've had the mouse for nearly a year now, and it's still using the original set of batteries (even though I sometimes forget to turn it off).
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: After I used for about a month, it is a great product, almost work on any surface, however, I have not tested it on glass yet. It is pointing to the screen fast and easy, the tracking pad is slowing down, this mouse is good for Windows 8 without touch screen. I accidntly dropped it couple times and it is okay. The only part is I cannot compare with their new windows 8 mouse, and I cannot test the 2 screens (extension).
customer_reviews.author: Jackson T. Liu

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for Windows 8
customer_reviews.text: I am running Windows 8 on an HP netbook (DM1z) that does not have touch screen, so I wanted something that would let me swipe and tap the new interface. This fits the bill. Took me a while to get adept at all of the gestures, and still have some problems scrolling up and down--not sure if it is the mouse hardware, mouse software, or Windows 8. But it seems like a good way to use Windows 8 if you don't have a new touchscreen computer.
customer_reviews.author: GrayingGuitarMan

customer_reviews.title: GREAT MOUSE
customer_reviews.text: Great design, love the rubber part on the sides, not to big and not to small, just perfect. touch scrolling works great and responsive. overall great product, as always with Logitech. ----- Update 2 years since i bought this mouse: Still working flawlessly, i haven't had the need to change the battery since i first used it (2 AA duracell batteries).
customer_reviews.author: Mario Corral

customer_reviews.title: Nice Size but I Miss the Scrolling Wheel
customer_reviews.text: The size of this mouse is perfect for my hands and it offers smooth movement. The packaging was a little rough to remove but the seller can't control how the manufacturers package their product. I'm only giving it 4 stars right now due to the fact that I'm still adjusting to the "no scrolling wheel." The wheel is replaced with a matte finished button/touchpad that one can simulate scrolling, which as of now can be a bit touchy (but as I stated, still getting used to it). After I've had it for a couple of months, I may update this review either positively or negatively...
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Bought mine 4 years ago and still going strong. Replaced batteries 3 times.
customer_reviews.text: If you could classify this thing as a tank, I would. Just lasts and last and lasts.
customer_reviews.author: heraldo

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse for CAD designers!
customer_reviews.text: if you are a Solidwork user on laptop, this one is for you! i do mechanical drawing a lot, which use middle mouse click very often to rotate objects, pan the design zoom in and out, this big center strip of button/touch scroll does the job so well.
customer_reviews.author: J. L

customer_reviews.title: Works great, very happy
customer_reviews.text: Got this off amazon for a much better price than retail or logitechs main site. Just got my new laptop (Lenovo y500) a couple days ago and plugged this baby in. Product came on time, installed easily in no time, and has a degree of customization to it that helps navigate around windows 8. I originally looked for this specific type of mouse because I run windows 8 without a touch screen and thought it would make the w8 experience much better, and it sure does. But even if not for windows 8 its a still a great mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: Love this mouse! I finally found something I can use to scroll quickly in any direction for work where I can’t use my Apple Magic Mouse. Too bad they stopped producing it.
customer_reviews.author: CMS

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 8.1 PC to test the mouses touch scrolling. It is ok but a little gimmicky . My regular Logitech M505 scroll button mouse works as well with Windows 8.1. Of special note, depending on your vendor, the Unifying transceiver may or may not be included with mouse. Caveat Emptor. Luckily I already had a spare transceiver.
customer_reviews.author: N. Austin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mouse.
customer_reviews.text: I use this mouse for both my laptop and my Microsoft surface tablet. I love it. It is the most precise and fluid mouse I have ever used. It is very comfortable, and yet it is compact so I can easily carry it in a pocket or bag. The USB stores inside the mouse by the batteries. It is easy to install, both of mine installed automatically within seconds and was ready to use. Logitech really did a good job with this piece.
customer_reviews.author: B123

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but would prefer a tradtional scroll wheel
customer_reviews.text: While I had been quite happy with my former Logitech mouse, it ceased to function properly with my new laptop running Windows 8.1. I specifically purchased the T400, which was advertised as compatible with Windows 8 8. I'm generally satisfied with this new mouse, except that I wish it had the traditional scroll wheel, which I found more convenient than the new "virtual wheel" occupying the center zone on the new mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Bloomenthal

customer_reviews.title: It has a nice feel to it
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for my laptop after using the one at work. It has a nice feel to it, tracks well and I like that I can touch scroll using the center button. I don't like that if I accidentally hit the center button, it opens the windows 8 home screen. I didn't quite understand what the windows 8 meant in the name of this mouse. Now I know.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Hollis

customer_reviews.title: Nice, smooth mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is a very smooth-to-the-touch mouse. It works very nicely with my Windows 8 OS. The clicking on this mouse has to be pronounced, which gives it a very solid/quality feel. The touch scrolling is seamless, noiseless, and works great. The custom touch gesture controls are an added bonus and makes navigation on the Windows 8 OS fun/easy to use. The cursor on the screen looks and feels very smooth when moving around (you can change speeds of it). Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Dieguez

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review about dead mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is an update to my review where my computer could not locate the unifying receiver. I blamed the receiver when it was in fact a problem with my USB controller. I'm going to 4 stars now because I do like this mouse and being able to open the Start screen from it is kind of fun. My only complaint is that I find it difficult to be precise when scrolling with touch gestures rather than a scroll wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry771

customer_reviews.title: Not so fast....
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouse, with many features. However, it has serious lag issues on my PC. I have a really nice PC that I custom built myself, and for some reason, I have not been able to get this working right. The keyboard works great with no lag, and so does my old microsoft mouse, which I went back to using. I had liked logitech in the past, but this kind of turned me off to their products.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: It takes a little getting use to but it works great.
customer_reviews.text: This was a love hate relationship. Since I wasn't use to this type of mouse I hated it at first and I mean I HATE IT!!! But kept using it saying to myself, "self, don't be old fart... technology changes everyday..." so now I really like it so the moral of the story is it gets a little getting use to and then it works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Shazini

customer_reviews.title: Not the head of the class
customer_reviews.text: Works just ok, sometimes it takes more ten a double click to open a process/program. Battery doesn't last as long as stated. I have changed mine four times in a little over a year. Yes, I use it daily. but at home so usage is very limited.
customer_reviews.author: Frank T

customer_reviews.title: I really love this mouse
customer_reviews.text: I really love this mouse. It has a cool new touch design! I bought it for a laptop I use on occasion, not my main computer and it's great for that. I prefer a beefier mouse for gaming and long term use, but this one suffices well for what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: WP

customer_reviews.title: Love IT!
customer_reviews.text: This Red!!!! it's so lovely. This mouse has great features and the battery last for ever!!! i had an ihome "mini" mouse and i had to change the batteries at least every 2 weeks. I purchased this mouse almost a year ago and i have not needed to change the battery yet!
customer_reviews.author: kelina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Windows 8 or 8.1 mouse!
customer_reviews.text: When I started using Windows 8, I realized that my existing mouse had limitations. You cannot slide with an ordinary mouse. Since I purchased this mouse, losing my laptop has gotten a lot easier. Of course, I did download the classic shell app so I could get some features back, but this mouse lets me browse through tiles easily.
customer_reviews.author: West Coast Girl

customer_reviews.title: Starter mous for windows 8
customer_reviews.text: This Logitech mouse, has good feel in the hand,size if good. Battery life is great and so is the software detection, I've tried in both windows 7 and Windows 8. The major pain with the mouse is interference, they should have made a bluetooth mouse instead of RF. Because I have lots of gadgets and around room, I would not recommend. Moved my speakers further away, and seem to had some relief, but speakers are shielded, and should not had had interference.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Finally, A Mouse I Can Live With
customer_reviews.text: I wanted an external mouse for my new laptop. I wanted something that would work with usb 3.0., and work on different types of surfaces. The setup was simple and it works great. Of course I purchased a slightly used mouse, but it was still in great condition. I your looking for a great mouse that includes Windows 8 features, this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: dlbutler922

customer_reviews.title: Not bad...
customer_reviews.text: I'm still getting used to it but I like the mouse. It does take some getting use to. My wife and I tend to accidently hit the center "scroll" button a lot, which sends you back to the tile screen when using Window's 8, when scrolling through a website page. However we do like the overall size and feel of the mouse. It does track really well compare to our old mouse as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse works great! But I like the look and feel of the T620. I used both in Windows 7 & Windows 8. They both worked well, but the T400 seemed to work better in Windows 7 because the T620 scroll touch does not work as well on Windows 7 as it does on Windows 8. Overall great mouse!
customer_reviews.author: ABC317

customer_reviews.title: works great and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice product. Easy to use and set up. I bought to work with my Asus 8.1. Even when you have a touch screen there are lots of times that you need to navigate using a mouse or pad. I don't like the touch pads at all especially the ASUS and this is a great alternative. Inexpensive too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good complement for the T650 Touchpad
customer_reviews.text: Both share the same USB receiver/transmitter so only one port is used up. Unlike thethough, the T400 uses two AA batteries. Nice and solid, though I would have preferred something just a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: M. V. Indrasoma

customer_reviews.title: Feels a little awkward initially
customer_reviews.text: I quickly got used to the smaller form factor of this mouse and it's usage. It connected right away to an existing Logitech wireless setup so no trouble there. It's accurate and the definitive "click" feedback you get when using it is reassuring for some reason. It kind of reminds me of Apple's Magic mouse both in form and function...I would give it 6 stars if I could!
customer_reviews.author: jevans911

customer_reviews.title: My finger started paining after using this mouse
customer_reviews.text: The left and right click buttons are very hard to click. I have used many wireless and wired mouses before but never got such kind of pain. Apart from this the mouse performs very good on Windows 8 and 7 OS. After reading soo many reviews and researching too much i am highly disappointed with this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Gani

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this mouse
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this mouse. Scroll wheel might take some getting used to for some, but personally, I really like it. Nice and smooth. No more noisy "click, click..." as you scroll down a page. :D I will say that Logitech's keyboard/mouse software sucks, but that's not this product. Just something to be aware of. If you do get the software, disable updates completely. Sucks up a ton of CPU resources on startup.
customer_reviews.author: cronk

customer_reviews.title: Great Windows mouse
customer_reviews.text: If you are ok with USB Wireless mouse (as opposed to bt) , this is an amazing Windows mouse. I have already purchased two. I use one at school and one at my house. In my house, I use it for my macbook pro bootcamp windows 7 version, since the mac mouse (which works great in mac os x), it is a bit too sensitive to touch. Great Mouse!
customer_reviews.author: Francisco R. O.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I hate this thing. The weird touchzone in the middle never scrolls properly no matter how much I change the settings. The three click zones don't work. Precision is bad for some reason. Obviously, doesn't work on glass - another negative. Worst mouse I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: eeee

customer_reviews.title: Fair
customer_reviews.text: A bit too small for my hand. I'll use it for a temp mouse for my laptop but still looking for a good full sized mouse. Also, the set point software didn't work great so I had to uninstall it and use the regular Windows settings. I thought I would like the touch pad instead of the wheel but I don't. If your finger isn't perfectly dry it gets sticky and doesn't slide well.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Nice Color
customer_reviews.text: The overall movement is nice but the center bar that replaces the roller is way too sensitive. When scrolling a page it sometimes (too much for me) jumps back to the last page. Forget using this for any type of game that uses the roller. Best thing it has going for it is the color.
customer_reviews.author: John D. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Mouse Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Logitech T400 mouse to use with a new Dell Inspiron 15z laptop with Windows 8 (no touch screen). The touch sensor emulates the touch screen swipe function very well. The only problem that I experience with it is that with an Internet Explorer application open, i.e. MSN, if I swipe my finger to the left with the touch sensor, the app will back up a page. Have to learn to keep my finger off of the sensor unless I'm using it. Mouse size and shape are very comfortable, friendly.
customer_reviews.author: John E.

customer_reviews.title: Love this mouse!
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is so easy! Set up is a piece of cake. Scrolling , swiping or clicking, this mouse does it all. I purchased this to replace a really good, more expensive mouse, and I like this one just as much. I love purple, which makes it better (and more obviously noticable, when one of the kids has stolen my mouse.)!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Mouse for Win 8
customer_reviews.text: The T 400 functions fine and is easily setup. It sometimes seems to have a mind of it's own and takes off in uncommanded directions. But if you do not try to get tricky and perform basic mouse functions like left/right and up/ down you will do OK. This is not a substitute for touch screen.
customer_reviews.author: Eagle Saint

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: I give this mouse 4/5 stars mostly due to the learning curve that comes with it. It's customizable and I definitely like the center touch scroll versus the normal roller; it's much quieter. I've withheld one star as it's still relatively new and I haven't quite customized it yet. I'm wondering if the new Windows 8.1 release will affect its capability.
customer_reviews.author: KLE880

customer_reviews.title: OK but I prefer a mouse with center wheel
customer_reviews.text: I use this for a laptop and not having a cord is nice BUT the control in the center is clumsy for vertical scrolling. The pointer does not stay put. I did not read instructions because the use of a mouse should be intuitive, so maybe I'm missing something.
customer_reviews.author: Gottfried

customer_reviews.title: Best Laptop Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Always on the lookout for new and better mouse. This one has just the right size and really enjoy the features. Have problems with the Logitech software suite causing lockups and other glitches. Just uninstall the crapware and the moujse works great with just Windows 7 drivers.
customer_reviews.author: Kirk Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Love This Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I had been using M325's and M305's for the past few years because they were cheap, and when I wanted a new one, they were everywhere. I decided to spend a bit and shell out for a nicer mouse to go with my new PC Setup, and I couldn't be happier with this T400. Love everything about it.
customer_reviews.author: OtakuLife005

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well, buy a Magic Mouse instead!
customer_reviews.text: I had thought that this mouse could be a less expensive alternative to the Apple Magic Mouse. I was wrong, the "Zone Touch" feature does not work well at all. It is not sensitive enough to scroll well on a website. I ended up returning the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Malone

customer_reviews.title: Decent Mouse - looks great - touchpad is good
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little getting used to the touchpad instead of a wheel, but I think it is an improvement. The mouse *looks* great. It is a bit too light and a bit too short, however. The plastic along the sides wears too quickly. I don't think I would buy another one, but I am not really displeased with having tried it.
customer_reviews.author: bgmCoder

customer_reviews.title: The first one still works great, however the newest one I got
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd T400 Mouse that I use both on a Mac and PD. The first one still works great, however the newest one I got, the left click button does not register unless you put a lot of pressure onto it. It tracks well otherwise and generally has a very long battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Smooth touch mouse
customer_reviews.text: Great product for a good price. Small and design well. Just becareful to go side ways on the touch pad. You will make the command to go to the next page when on the net. Otherwise I am please with this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: T400 makes Windows 8 usable
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought a new laptop with Windows 8 on it and no touch screen, not realizing how touch-centric windows 8 is. When my wireless mouse failed, I started checking into replacements that were designed to work with Windows 8 and this one came with some of the better ratings. I found the installation to be quite easy and was up and running with a much better interface for the windows 8 environment than the previous mouse. The gestures feel natural and make use of the nuances of Windows 8. I did adjust the responsiveness to my liking. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: too sensitive
customer_reviews.text: beautiful mouse... much, much too sensitive. every time I reach over it for a keyboard, it flies all over the place - this is especially awkward in spreadsheets. Works best with windows 8, but inside applications, it is a pain to control.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia S

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Mouse for Win 8
customer_reviews.text: It does everything it promised. Normal Right and Left clicks; smooth Horizontal glide from middle button; AND comfortable! Works great with my Lenovo Computer that connected to HDTV and works great with WIN 8 APPs I HIGHLY recommend it to any body that wanna uses Win 8 it really works without no fault.,
customer_reviews.author: Reza

customer_reviews.title: We like it, But Prefer the Wheel
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, good sleek look, smooth but not having the wheel and after 60 days of use I still don't scroll well with this touch mouse. I always scroll way past things as it is very sensitive. With a wheel you just have strict control. Try it as it works just not perfect for me the way I'd like.
customer_reviews.author: skf1965

customer_reviews.title: Best Windows 8 experience for those who don't have touch screens
customer_reviews.text: My spouse hates the Windows 8 start screen, but I like it. the quick jump buttons on the middle bar are the best, plus it takes scrolling, and left/right swipe can be programmed. I have left swipe "go back" and it's so easy and light to use.
customer_reviews.author: WebersMN

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work on Mac
customer_reviews.text: Feels well built and the touch scroll surface is nice. Just a heads-up, note that this mouse does not work (at all) with my Macbook Pro running Mountain Lion, and Logitech does not provide MacOS drivers for this mouse. So, seems like a great mouse, if you run Windows.
customer_reviews.author: Fletch

customer_reviews.title: cheap, stiff and difficult to use
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This was the cheapest mouse I've ever seen. It's hard to use, hard to hold, the buttons are way too stiff and the scrolling and Window's 8 features left me completely unimpressed. How this product gets the high rating is a mystery to me.
customer_reviews.author: digitaldaryl

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking mouse but in real life it has bad ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking mouse but in real life it has bad ergonomic, awkward scrolling and after 2.5 years left button is broken and doesn't click from first press. I always liked Logitech products but now I'm disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: OK

customer_reviews.title: It's awesome mouse
customer_reviews.text: Like my new Logitech mouse! My other mouse had a sticking scroll wheel so I decided it was smart to go with a mouse without a scroll wheel. Best choice! This works immediately when the transmitter is plugged in but downloading the software just improves the experience. Love that I can smoothly scroll down/up through web pages, but also that I can go "back" on web pages with a right-to-left swipe across the touch area. Nice feature! It's best mouse ever for my work. Recommended seller! Many thanks
customer_reviews.author: Andrey

customer_reviews.title: Bought ALL the colors -- are we crazy for these mice?
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech T400 mice are the best ever. Although they hype Windows 8, these mice are for Windows 7 and XP too -- it says so on the package. We have all the various colors: berry, plum, and 2 black, and are about to complete our herd to include cherry. We are so crazy about the T400, we even sent one as a gift to a friend in Canada -- he still has a cord mouse, can you believe it?
customer_reviews.author: Mr. C

customer_reviews.title: The Logitech Zone Touch Mouse T400 is truly a unique experience!
customer_reviews.text: From the moment I unpacked it I knew I was in for some fun. This mouse is so comfortable, so easy to use use, the right size for my hand, extremely responsive to my swipes, and I am in LOVE with it. I only wish that it had been invented years ago. If you are wondering whether to order it, I say don't wait.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse
customer_reviews.text: Great for Windows 8.1 laptop. This is the second one I have purchased. I bought one for myself and then purchased another lap top ( 8.1 ) for my wife and got her one too.. Not expensive and has all the functions.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Proctor

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Wireless Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic wireless mouse. This works perfectly for stowing in my bag to have a mouse when I am traveling. I also like the touch scroll feature. It works well, and I don't have to worry about debris getting inside a wheel like most other wireless mice.
customer_reviews.author: N. McGehee

customer_reviews.title: I like!
customer_reviews.text: It works pretty smoothly for me. Clicking is pretty quiet and the touch wheel is nice and sensitive. Wireless range seems to be better than most mice. Battery life is better than my last logitech mouse but that's all I can say about it for now since I haven't had to replace the batteries yet.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B

customer_reviews.title: Beauty mouse with mature problems !!!
customer_reviews.text: Hi I bought this mouse for 20 bucks. Pros : 1.5 years with two batteries ! Light, even with two batteries Great materials .soft and enjoyable. Hyperfast Scrolling simulation. just like Anywhere MX. Cons : Faulty button ! The left buttons releases while dragging ! so annoying ! Not ergonomic ! Not for gamers ! you cannot change weapons with scroll-bar.cannot change images with scroll. It's scroll is just for page scrolling navigation.
customer_reviews.author: Rostamiani

customer_reviews.title: Batteries Included!
customer_reviews.text: I have the Surface2 w/ Windows 8. This mouse is PERFECT! Just plug receiver in and switch the mouse on. That's it! I love everything from the packaging (no scissors required :) to the pretty purple color and the ease of use. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Xcellent product !
customer_reviews.text: This mouse does exactly what is written and no any problems whatsoever, work really good. I would like that is little bigger, because I have larger palms and fingers, but that have nothing to do with quality of product. Anyway very happy !
customer_reviews.author: Glamak

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as expected
customer_reviews.text: My reason for buying this mouse was because I didn't like the way the touchpad on my laptop scrolled. The Logitech T400 scrolling is not as fluid as I would like. It stalls quite a bit and I often just end up using the side bar to scroll. I should have bought one with a roller but thought this one would do the trick. It's ok but not great.
customer_reviews.author: Nickib64

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have a Logitech wireless keyboard so I was able to link this with existing unifying receiver instead of the one that came with it. I really like the touch strip in the middle instead of a scroll wheel. It works just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Carol L.

customer_reviews.title: Its okay
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had the laser tracking like the other Logitech I use, "Darkfield laser" or something like that... you cant scroll on glass or some surfaces but other than that it was a good value at the price... way cheaper than the local office store.
customer_reviews.author: Angry Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Too small for my hands
customer_reviews.text: Here's the skinny: * The mouse was too small for my hands (probably considered "large" men's hands; I can just barely reach a 10th on the piano). It was uncomfortable after a few hours use. When I switched back to a regular mouse, it was fine. * The touch technology (I used with Windows 7 on a modern computer with SSD) is not as mature as other touch technology I have used (e.g. Magic Mouse). * I'm still happier with a cheaper full-size mouse. I'm using the Logitech M510 and works just like you'd expect; just don't expect it to change your life.
customer_reviews.author: mr_reviewer00

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye touch pad
customer_reviews.text: I really am enjoying have this mouse for my windows 8 laptop without a touch screen and just a touch pad. Easy to install. Has an on off button to save battery life. Moves smoothly on just about any surface. Love it because it makes navigating around Windows 8 so much easier. I endorse the product
customer_reviews.author: Taren

customer_reviews.title: I love the light weight mouse and contoured grip. I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: I definitely recommend this product. The usb plug is very tiny, making it almost invisible. It takes time to get used to not having the normal scroll wheel, but once you get used to that, you'll love the touch pad on top of the mouse for scrolling.
customer_reviews.author: Rita Suarez

customer_reviews.title: I really like it.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why this mouse style isn't more popular, I really like it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Grove
